statsguruLinks.title: SA's ODI wins in Sri Lanka

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla lbw b Mendis 109 (130b 8x4 1x6 176m) SR: 83.84

dismissalComment.html: huge blow! Amla was trying to be cheeky as he moved well outside off stump. But Mendis sends this nice and full. Too full to sweep, which was what Amla tried to do and is caught in front of middle. Massive innings, but South Africa's finishers have to make sure it translates into a good total

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Kulasekara b Mendis 75 (70b 5x4 1x6 96m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: oh dear! he's chipped it to long-off! He's looked excellent since the moment he came out to bat and that partnership with Amla has put South Africa on top. But this was a simple, good length ball that he chose to hit over the top. But having decided that, he should have hit it harder than that. Almost picked out the fielder

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: plumb in front! Kallis bags a duck! This was the carrom ball and the batsman has not read it at all. Plays all around it as he looks to nudge it through midwicket and is struck on the back pad as the ball pitches and turns away,. Would have clattered into middle and off

oh dear! he's chipped it to long-off! He's looked excellent since the moment he came out to bat and that partnership with Amla has put South Africa on top. But this was a simple, good length ball that he chose to hit over the top. But having decided that, he should have hit it harder than that. Almost picked out the fielder

huge blow! Amla was trying to be cheeky as he moved well outside off stump. But Mendis sends this nice and full. Too full to sweep, which was what Amla tried to do and is caught in front of middle. Massive innings, but South Africa's finishers have to make sure it translates into a good total

he's given it away! Wonderful bowling from Senanayake though. Lovely flight and the batsman couldn't resist from pulling out the drive. But he couldn;t quite reach the pitch and ended up scooping the ball to short cover. Good, low catch from Dilshan too

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock b Mathews 27 (35b 3x4 1x6 53m) SR: 77.14

dismissalComment.html: he's chopped it on! Mathews has a gleeful smile on his face. This was full and wide outside off. De Kock set up for the cover drive again, but played too early. This is a slow pitch, remember. Good strike for Sri Lanka. End of a sparkling little innings from de Kock

Too full to sweep, which was what Amla tried to do and is caught in front of middle. Massive innings, but South Africa's finishers have to make sure it translates into a good total

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c Dilshan b Senanayake 16 (25b 0x4 0x6 29m) SR: 64

dismissalComment.html: he's given it away! Wonderful bowling from Senanayake though. Lovely flight and the batsman couldn't resist from pulling out the drive. But he couldn;t quite reach the pitch and ended up scooping the ball to short cover. Good, low catch from Dilshan too

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c sub (F du Plessis) b McLaren
dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c sub (F du Plessis) b McLaren 88 (84b 9x4 0x6 144m) SR: 104.76

dismissalComment.html: this is right off the bottom of the bat, it's a steepler but extra cover has got under it. It was full and just a touch too wide and made him reach for it. Magnificent innings from Sanga, but the demands of Duckworth and Lewis and a resurgent South Africa pace attack get to him

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c de Kock b Morkel 40 (46b 5x4 0x6 80m) SR: 86.95

dismissalComment.html: they've kept teasing him and teasing him and finally Dilshan manages a thick outside edge through to the keeper. Another short and wide delivery that he chased without any footwork to end a useful little innings

he's struck straight away! Brilliant catch from the keeper! It was short, it needed to be cut but Mahela only manages a healthy edge which de Kock pouches very safely. South Africa's top-notch fielding comes to their rescue again

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: rush of blood and Tahir has set off for his customary run. Taps his chest in delight after luring the outside edge. Absolutely awful shot from Priyanjan as he danced down the track and went for a slog sweep against the turn. Ends up giving an asy catch to short third man
how bout that, the stumps are rattled and its the googly again! Senanayake pushed at the ball gingerly, he did not pick it at all and has to walk back
off you go, says Styen as Kulasekara goes for a dab to third man and chops a short ball well outside off onto his stumps. The crowd in Colombo is stunned

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: this is a mistimed hoick, McLaren gets under a swirler and South Africa take the first game in convincing fashion. Steyn goes short and Mendis backs away to try and smoke it out of the park but has fell way off the mark

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Morkel b Philander 34 (33b 6x4 0x6 38m) SR: 103.03

dismissalComment.html: he's picked out short fine leg! It was another slower short ball, rather like the one for the free hit. Kusal pivots on the back foot and pulls, but he's hit it off a bit of a top edge and lobbed a low catch to Morkel at short fine leg. Big unit needed to dive forward and did well. Claims it straight away, but Kusal wants to wait. The umpires consult each other, then throw it to the third ump who has a simple enough decision

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c de Kock b Morkel 40 (46b 5x4 0x6 80m) SR: 86.95

dismissalComment.html: they've kept teasing him and teasing him and finally Dilshan manages a thick outside edge through to the keeper. Another short and wide delivery that he chased without any footwork to end a useful little innings

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c de Kock b Morkel 13 (13b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: huge strike for Morkel as he induces the outside edge of a man in prime form! Loose shot from Mathews as he threw his bat at one outside his off stump and the keeper takes a regulation catch.

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne b McLaren 15 (26b 0x4 0x6 34m) SR: 57.69

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! This was full and straight and he goes for a hoick across the line. Sanga was hitting wonderfully at the other end. He threw his head back at the non-strikers' That was not the shot to play, especially considering you expose the tail

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

Magnificent innings from Sanga, but the demands of Duckworth and Lewis and a resurgent South Africa pace attack get to him

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara b Steyn 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: off you go, says Styen as Kulasekara goes for a dab to third man and chops a short ball well outside off onto his stumps. The crowd in Colombo is stunned

dismissalText.commentary: Sachithra Senanayake b Imran Tahir 6 (5b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: how bout that, the stumps are rattled and its the googly again! Senanayake pushed at the ball gingerly, he did not pick it at all and has to walk back

headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ajantha Mendis c McLaren b Steyn 0 (7b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: this is a mistimed hoick, McLaren gets under a swirler and South Africa take the first game in convincing fashion. Steyn goes short and Mendis backs away to try and smoke it out of the park but has fell way off the mark

commentPostTextItems.html: 6.00 pm That's all we have for you. Do join us for the second ODI when South Africa will plan to wrap up a historic maiden series triumph in his country and Sri Lanka will be priming their claws for a comeback. Its bound to be a cracker and we hope to have your company again on Wednesday. That will be a Day-night affair, mind you. So until then, this is Alagappan Muthu going quiet
Daniel Alexande: "Sri Lanka should appoint Amla as SL vice-captain, that's the only way to stop him scoring "

Hashim Amla is the Man of the Match for his 13th ton in ODI cricket. "Obviously it was a good wicket to bat on, I know we managed to bowl Sri Lanka for 240 but the game went right to the 40th over./ The pitch eased out a little bit, but also the bowlers bowled really well. AB got away in our partnership and allowed me to play my game. It was a little slow, but it stayed the same throughout the game and that's fair. No, I dont think so. Obviously when the Tests start I'll put the thinking cap on, now I'm just concentrating on help AB out in the ODIs"

"Hopefully on our way, Certainly not there yet. Sri Lanka are a very goot team at home," says AB de Villiers. "We fought really well and really proud of our first innings here. I wasn;t too happy with my dismissal. I'm not going to go easy with myself. I thought the guys recovered really well. McLaren and Miller showed what this team was bout in the end. Its always a concern when Sanga walks out and Dilshan also played really well. We have to come out with some answers like we did today. We are very motivated to win our first series here, things have started really well and we'll have to go really hard in the next few games,"

5.55 pm "We had a bad day at the office. South Africans played better cricket and we were rusty," says Angelo Mathews. "After the start we got, the middle order made some poor shots selection and that cost us the game. If we'd held onto our catches, it would have been different. It was a very good wicket and the margin of error was very small. We bowed 45 overs very well. We are definitely under pressure but its pretty simple, we have to pull our socs up and win,"

South Africa had to come from behind a few times in this game. First when they lost a couple of top-order wickets together and AB de Villiers and Hashim Amla strung together a very business-like partnership. And then while bowling, Sri Lanka had got off to a rapid start and Kumar Sangakkara was batting like a dream again. But Imran Tahir, after being smacked around, and Ryan McClaren with some canny change of pace secured a well-fought victory for the visitors

5.40 pm Considering the top order's performance, Sri Lanka would feel very aggrieved with his result. But South Africa have said all along - they've learned their lessons, they have a better side this time and they were looking at Tahir as an attacking option. All of those claims came to pass today as they secured only their third win in 17 ODIs against Sri Lanka in Sri Lanka
tAHIR: "5 wickets in 4 overs .. i was expecting that it ll go to 49, 50 .. but just 40.3 SL wts going on ???"

commentTextItems.html: goes for the yorker, but it is just a little too full and outside off. Mendis sets up for a swipe over cover and is beaten

commentPreTextItems.html: Steyn takes aim at the last wicket needed for South Africa

commentTextItems.html: shortish and outside off, Malinga backs away to flat bat it down the ground. Mistimed
another wrong 'un, quick and flat, and Malinga seems to have picked it as he pulls to midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: sneaks in a quicker delivery and Malinga, who was down the pitch, manages to skew it to backward point
this one is into orbit. Uses his feet and launches this over long-on to bring up the first six of Sri Lanka's innings

commentPreTextItems.html: Some of the crowd are trying to beat the Colombo traffic by leaving early
jitu: "Plz bring tisara next match....... " Malinga is the last man in

commentTextItems.html: comes down the track which makes Tahir shorten the length of his googly. Malinga bunts it down to the bowler

dismissalText.commentary: Sachithra Senanayake b Imran Tahir 6 (5b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 120

commentTextItems.html: how bout that, the stumps are rattled and its the googly again! Senanayake pushed at the ball gingerly, he did not pick it at all and has to walk back

commentPreTextItems.html: Imran Tahir, the man who turned this match around with one little wicket, comes back

commentTextItems.html: goes for the googly and this skids onto him and raps him on the pads. He was rooted to the crease while going for a flick, might have drifted down leg which is why the the umpire says no and AB declines to review

commentPreTextItems.html: neil: "slow over rate won't matter if they bowl them all out, which is looking more and more likely." Exactly what we were discussing here in office

commentTextItems.html: how did that miss the off stump? It was a good length ball and Mendis continues on his merry way backing away and going for the loft over the off side. Misses comprehensively again

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: deceives him with a lovely slower ball, too good for Mendis as he looks to launch it down the ground. Doesn't connect

commentPostTextItems.html: shihan: "@Jan: Sanga had to play a rash shot because what Thirimanne did earlier..DL par score got to Sanga with the fall of Thiri."

commentTextItems.html: that's a menacing bouncer to the tailender who manages to duck under it. Right over off stump there

commentPreTextItems.html: Ajanthan Mendis is at No. 10. Sri Lanka have lost three wickets in the batting powerplay

commentTextItems.html: straight away comes down the track and misses the wild waft outside off

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara b Steyn 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 33.33

commentPreTextItems.html: Nathan: "13 overs to go with less than 30 minutes of play left. Why was the delay. Slow over rate?" Will happen with a four man pace attack

commentTextItems.html: off you go, says Styen as Kulasekara goes for a dab to third man and chops a short ball well outside off onto his stumps. The crowd in Colombo is stunned
enough width for Senanayake to slice it behind point. Steyn ventured a little fuller than his traditional back of a length
can't beat slip this time. Kallis dives to his right and does his bit to add further pressure on the hosts. The par score is 254 now. Sri Lanka way behind

commentPostTextItems.html: Jan: "after seeing Sangakkara's reaction of the the Thirimanne dismissal, how would he react to his own silly shot?"

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: another short ball and Senanayake has steered it nicely to third man again. This time it's just a single

commentPreTextItems.html: Sachithra Senanayake is out in the middle now and the par score has ballooned

commentTextItems.html: dabbed away past the lone slip to the third man boundary. Deft little stroke there

dismissalText.long: c sub (F du Plessis) b McLaren
dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c sub (F du Plessis) b McLaren 88 (84b 9x4 0x6 144m) SR: 104.76

commentTextItems.html: this is right off the bottom of the bat, it's a steepler but extra cover has got under it. It was full and just a touch too wide and made him reach for it. Magnificent innings from Sanga, but the demands of Duckworth and Lewis and a resurgent South Africa pace attack get to him

commentPreTextItems.html: Kulasekara rushes out to the middle. Touches the turf for some good luck. Du Plessis is chatting with McLaren and Steyn regarding the field and bowling plans

commentTextItems.html: flicked away from off stump for a single to long leg

headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock b Mathews 27 (35b 3x4 1x6 53m) SR: 77.14

dismissalComment.html: he's chopped it on! Mathews has a gleeful smile on his face. This was full and wide outside off. De Kock set up for the cover drive again, but played too early. This is a slow pitch, remember. Good strike for Sri Lanka. End of a sparkling little innings from de Kock

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis lbw b Mendis 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: plumb in front! Kallis bags a duck! This was the carrom ball and the batsman has not read it at all. Plays all around it as he looks to nudge it through midwicket and is struck on the back pad as the ball pitches and turns away,. Would have clattered into middle and off

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Kulasekara b Mendis 75 (70b 5x4 1x6 96m) SR: 107.14

dismissalComment.html: oh dear! he's chipped it to long-off! He's looked excellent since the moment he came out to bat and that partnership with Amla has put South Africa on top. But this was a simple, good length ball that he chose to hit over the top. But having decided that, he should have hit it harder than that. Almost picked out the fielder

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla lbw b Mendis 109 (130b 8x4 1x6 176m) SR: 83.84

dismissalComment.html: huge blow! Amla was trying to be cheeky as he moved well outside off stump. But Mendis sends this nice and full. Too full to sweep, which was what Amla tried to do and is caught in front of middle. Massive innings, but South Africa's finishers have to make sure it translates into a good total

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c Dilshan b Senanayake 16 (25b 0x4 0x6 29m) SR: 64

dismissalComment.html: he's given it away! Wonderful bowling from Senanayake though. Lovely flight and the batsman couldn't resist from pulling out the drive. But he couldn;t quite reach the pitch and ended up scooping the ball to short cover. Good, low catch from Dilshan too

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Morkel b Philander 34 (33b 6x4 0x6 38m) SR: 103.03

dismissalComment.html: he's picked out short fine leg! It was another slower short ball, rather like the one for the free hit. Kusal pivots on the back foot and pulls, but he's hit it off a bit of a top edge and lobbed a low catch to Morkel at short fine leg. Big unit needed to dive forward and did well. Claims it straight away, but Kusal wants to wait. The umpires consult each other, then throw it to the third ump who has a simple enough decision

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c de Kock b Morkel 40 (46b 5x4 0x6 80m) SR: 86.95

dismissalComment.html: they've kept teasing him and teasing him and finally Dilshan manages a thick outside edge through to the keeper. Another short and wide delivery that he chased without any footwork to end a useful little innings

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c sub (F du Plessis) b McLaren
dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c sub (F du Plessis) b McLaren 88 (84b 9x4 0x6 144m) SR: 104.76

dismissalComment.html: this is right off the bottom of the bat, it's a steepler but extra cover has got under it. It was full and just a touch too wide and made him reach for it. Magnificent innings from Sanga, but the demands of Duckworth and Lewis and a resurgent South Africa pace attack get to him

dismissalText.long: c de Kock b Imran Tahir
dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c de Kock b Imran Tahir 10 (16b 0x4 0x6 27m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: he's struck straight away! Brilliant catch from the keeper! It was short, it needed to be cut but Mahela only manages a healthy edge which de Kock pouches very safely. South Africa's top-notch fielding comes to their rescue again

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ashan Priyanjan c Kallis b Imran Tahir 5 (8b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: rush of blood and Tahir has set off for his customary run. Taps his chest in delight after luring the outside edge. Absolutely awful shot from Priyanjan as he danced down the track and went for a slog sweep against the turn. Ends up giving an asy catch to short third man

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c de Kock b Morkel 13 (13b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: huge strike for Morkel as he induces the outside edge of a man in prime form! Loose shot from Mathews as he threw his bat at one outside his off stump and the keeper takes a regulation catch.

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne b McLaren 15 (26b 0x4 0x6 34m) SR: 57.69

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! This was full and straight and he goes for a hoick across the line. Sanga was hitting wonderfully at the other end. He threw his head back at the non-strikers' That was not the shot to play, especially considering you expose the tail

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara b Steyn 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: off you go, says Styen as Kulasekara goes for a dab to third man and chops a short ball well outside off onto his stumps. The crowd in Colombo is stunned

dismissalText.commentary: Sachithra Senanayake b Imran Tahir 6 (5b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: how bout that, the stumps are rattled and its the googly again! Senanayake pushed at the ball gingerly, he did not pick it at all and has to walk back

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ajantha Mendis c McLaren b Steyn 0 (7b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: this is a mistimed hoick, McLaren gets under a swirler and South Africa take the first game in convincing fashion. Steyn goes short and Mendis backs away to try and smoke it out of the park but has fell way off the mark

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga not out 6 (4b 0x4 1x6 5m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: off you go, says Styen as Kulasekara goes for a dab to third man and chops a short ball well outside off onto his stumps. The crowd in Colombo is stunned

notes: South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 46 runs, 0 wicket)
South Africa: 50 runs in 10.5 overs (65 balls), Extras 5
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 65 balls (HM Amla 20, Q de Kock 25, Ex 5)
Drinks: South Africa - 77/2 in 16.0 overs (HM Amla 31, AB de Villiers 9)
Over 20.3: Review by Sri Lanka (Bowling), Umpire - SJ Davis, Batsman - HM Amla (Struck down)
South Africa: 100 runs in 20.4 overs (124 balls), Extras 11
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 54 balls (HM Amla 25, AB de Villiers 23, Ex 3)
HM Amla: 50 off 74 balls (4 x 4)
Powerplay 2: Overs 23.1 - 28.0 (Batting side - 34 runs, 0 wicket)
South Africa: 150 runs in 28.1 overs (169 balls), Extras 12
3rd Wicket: 100 runs in 96 balls (HM Amla 51, AB de Villiers 45, Ex 4)
AB de Villiers: 50 off 52 balls (3 x 4)
Drinks: South Africa - 191/2 in 33.0 overs (HM Amla 86, AB de Villiers 63)
South Africa: 200 runs in 33.4 overs (203 balls), Extras 17
3rd Wicket: 150 runs in 135 balls (HM Amla 67, AB de Villiers 75, Ex 9)
HM Amla: 100 off 118 balls (7 x 4, 1 x 6)
South Africa: 250 runs in 44.4 overs (269 balls), Extras 18
6th Wicket: 50 runs in 30 balls (DA Miller 31, R McLaren 18, Ex 1)
South Africa: 300 runs in 49.4 overs (299 balls), Extras 19
Innings Break: South Africa - 304/5 in 50.0 overs (DA Miller 36, R McLaren 22)
Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 59 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 7.3 overs (46 balls), Extras 3
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 46 balls (MDKJ Perera 34, TM Dilshan 13, Ex 3)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 93/1 in 15.0 overs (TM Dilshan 38, KC Sangakkara 17)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 16.6 overs (103 balls), Extras 4
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 26.1 overs (159 balls), Extras 6
KC Sangakkara: 50 off 54 balls (4 x 4)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 163/4 in 29.0 overs (KC Sangakkara 55, AD Mathews 13)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 38 runs, 4 wickets)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 35.3 overs (215 balls), Extras 7
6th Wicket: 50 runs in 46 balls (KC Sangakkara 33, HDRL Thirimanne 15, Ex 4)

stories.title: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2014
stories.subTitle: 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2014
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the first ODI, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2014

stories.title: Floodlights restriction hurts Sri Lanka's chase
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Floodlights restriction hurts Sri Lanka's chase
stories.summary: Sri Lanka Cricket's attempts to cut operational costs has affected the cricket in the first ODI, as Sri Lanka lost wickets chasing a Duckworth-Lewis equation, when light faded quickly in the late afternoon
stories.byline: Andrew Fidel Fernando at the R Premadasa Stadium

image.caption: Lahiru Thirimanne is bowled by Ryan McLaren
image.longCaption: Lahiru Thirimanne is bowled by Ryan McLaren, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 6, 2014

stories.title: County stint with Surrey serves Amla well
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: County stint with Surrey serves Amla well
stories.summary: Hashim Amla has admitted that "playing a bit of cricket in the county stint" with Surrey had helped him prepare for the ongoing series against Sri Lanka

image.caption: Hashim Amla drives on the off side
image.longCaption: Hashim Amla drives on the off side, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 6, 2014

stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo

image.caption: Imran Tahir exults after dismissing Mahela Jayawardene
image.longCaption: Imran Tahir exults after dismissing Mahela Jayawardene, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 6, 2014

stories.title: Amla ton underpins large SA win
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Hashim Amla ton underpins large SA win
stories.summary: Hashim Amla scored a hundred, had a 151-run partnership with the free-scoring AB de Villiers, and led South Africa to a match-winning 304 for 5

image.caption: AB de Villiers and Hashim Amla added 151 runs for the third wicket
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers and Hashim Amla added 151 runs for the third wicket, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 6, 2014

stories.title: South Africa wary of spin and heat
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: South Africa wary of spin and heat
stories.summary: South Africa are wary of the heat and greater help for spinners in Sri Lanka but captain AB de Villiers believes they are better prepared

image.caption: Jacques Kallis and AB de Villiers have a bat
image.longCaption: Jacques Kallis and AB de Villiers have a bat, Delhi, February 21, 2011

stories.title: SL ready for more verbal bouts if needled
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: SL ready for more verbal bouts if needled
stories.summary: Angelo Mathews did not think South Africa would go after Sri Lanka verbally, but warned that the hosts were capable of giving it back, like they had in England

image.caption: Angelo Mathews shares a few words with Joe Root
image.longCaption: Angelo Mathews shares a few words with Joe Root, England v Sri Lanka, 2nd Investec Test, Headingley, 5th day, June 24, 2014

stories.title: No stroll for favourites Sri Lanka
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: No stroll for favourites Sri Lanka
stories.summary: Sri Lanka begin as favourites, but they will not expect to stroll past the visitors so easily this time, unlike the 4-1 drubbing last year
stories.byline: The Preview by Andrew Fidel Fernando in Colombo

image.caption: Angelo Mathews and AB de Villiers pose with the series trophy
image.longCaption: Angelo Mathews and AB de Villiers pose with the series trophy, Colombo, July 4, 2014

videos.title: Proud of the way Tahir fought back - de Villiers
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
videos.seoTitle: Proud of the way Imran Tahir fought back - AB de Villiers
videos.summary: South Africa captain AB de Villiers talks about Hashim Amla's hundred, how his batsmen recovered in the last 10 overs and the way Imran Tahir came back after his first spell in the 75-run win against Sri Lanka

videos.title: Beating SL will be big before World Cup - Domingo
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
videos.seoTitle: Beating SL will be big before World Cup - Domingo
videos.summary: Russell Domingo and AB de Villiers talk about their chances in the ODI series against Sri Lanka, Imran Tahir's role in the team and how they hope to perform better this time

videos.title: Proud of the way Tahir fought back - de Villiers
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
videos.seoTitle: Proud of the way Imran Tahir fought back - AB de Villiers
videos.summary: South Africa captain AB de Villiers talks about Hashim Amla's hundred, how his batsmen recovered in the last 10 overs and the way Imran Tahir came back after his first spell in the 75-run win against Sri Lanka

videos.title: Beating SL will be big before World Cup - Domingo
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
videos.seoTitle: Beating SL will be big before World Cup - Domingo
videos.summary: Russell Domingo and AB de Villiers talk about their chances in the ODI series against Sri Lanka, Imran Tahir's role in the team and how they hope to perform better this time

recentReportStory.title: Amla ton underpins large SA win
recentReportStory.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
recentReportStory.seoTitle: Hashim Amla ton underpins large SA win
recentReportStory.summary: Hashim Amla scored a hundred, had a 151-run partnership with the free-scoring AB de Villiers, and led South Africa to a match-winning 304 for 5

image.caption: AB de Villiers and Hashim Amla added 151 runs for the third wicket
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers and Hashim Amla added 151 runs for the third wicket, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 6, 2014

recentReportStory.credit: Firdose Moonda is ESPNcricinfo's South Africa correspondent

recentPreviewStory.title: No stroll for favourites Sri Lanka
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: No stroll for favourites Sri Lanka
recentPreviewStory.summary: Sri Lanka begin as favourites, but they will not expect to stroll past the visitors so easily this time, unlike the 4-1 drubbing last year
recentPreviewStory.byline: The Preview by Andrew Fidel Fernando in Colombo

image.caption: Angelo Mathews and AB de Villiers pose with the series trophy
image.longCaption: Angelo Mathews and AB de Villiers pose with the series trophy, Colombo, July 4, 2014

recentPreviewStory.credit: Andrew Fidel Fernando is ESPNcricinfo's Sri Lanka correspondent. @andrewffernando
